description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING BUILDINGS ON SITE AND THE ERECTION OF A TERRACE OF SEVEN FOUR STOREY TOWN HOUSES WITH ASSOCIATED CAR PARKING.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The door(s) of the garage hereby permitted shall not open over or encroach in any way on the highway, or shared accessway.

Condition : 3 - The proposed tree planting/landscaping scheme(indicated on the deposited plan) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval and be implemented during the next planting season after the completion of building operations on the site, or within such longer period as may be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Before the building/extension hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the appro elevation of the shall be glazed with obscured glass and fixed shut and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (or any Orders amending or re-enacting of those orders) no extensions or dormer windows shall be added to the dwellinghouse/dwellinghouses hereby permitted without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for Condition: To ensure that a satisfactory form of development takes place on the site and to protect the amenities of the locality.

Condition : 6 - The developer shall provide adequate facilities for appropriate investigation of this archaeologically important site in advance of redevelopment, by an investigating body to be nominated by the Council.  Reason for Condition: To ensure that there is an opportunity to properly investigate and record information on this site, which is considered to be of high archaeological importance. Informative: This site is within an area of historical importance, where ground works will result in the destruction of archaeological remains. Your attention is drawn to the existence of a Code of Practice agreed by the British Property Federation and SCAUM. The Council expects the applicants and the nominated investgating body to abide by the provision of this code.
